body:
See also https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/pull/154#issuecomment-1214289747.

For `alnorm`, we have to:

* [ ] add `--allow-implicit-interface` lfortran flag
* [ ] with this flag, create an implicit interface (that is, explicit in ASR, but not present in the source code) to `alnorm` from the way it is called, so it will be something like `real function alnorm(x, l)`, where `x` is real and `l` is logical. I am guessing the result is `real`, possibly using the fact that `alnorm` is implicitly typed, so it starts with `a` so it's a real.

We can figure out the details as we go. If we do the interface, then I think that will already work with our LLVM backend.

labels.name: SciPy
labels.description: issues related to enable LFortran to compile the entire FORTRAN codebase in SciPy

body:
I should, execute it 
```
./src/bin/lfortran --show-asr --fixed-form --implicit-typing --allow-implicit-interface ~/scipy/scipy/stats/statlib/spearman.f 
```
like this right?

On executing this I get the following error
```
The following argument was not expected: --allow-implicit-interface
Run with --help for more information.
```
@Pranavchiku yes, we have to implement this according to the TODO list at https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/issues/607#issuecomment-1217960923.
okay, how can I add that flag?, I mean any particular file associated with it wherein I can perform that?

You have to open `src/bin/lfortran.cpp` and see how other compiler options are handled, and just add this one. Add it to `CompilerOptions` (just see how `--implicit-typing` is handled and do exactly the same). But then the hard part is to go into the appropriate place in AST->ASR which is returning the above error, and then check if this compiler option is set. If it is, then you create that interface as described above. If it is not set, then you return an error as it does now.
@certik , the error(while conversion from AST->ASR) will be returned from ```src/bin/lfortran.cpp``` file right?
You keep the error as is, but you add a branch that does not fail if `----allow-implicit-interface` is passed.
I looked into ```src/bin/lfortran/semantics/ast_to_asr.cpp``` ig the error is not present in there
I am actually trying to print, some manual output to check if it is coming to this line or not, any suggestions?

Okay, so ig ```alnorm``` is not implemented in the file ```src/bin/lfortran/sematics/comptime_eval.h```

[comptime_eval.h](https://github.com/lfortran/lfortran/blob/main/src/lfortran/semantics/comptime_eval.h#L64)

issue.title: Add `--allow-implicit-interface` in compiler options

labels.name: SciPy
labels.description: issues related to enable LFortran to compile the entire FORTRAN codebase in SciPy

issue.body:
Fixes #607 
Fixes #689 
Added configuration for --allow-implicit-interface in lfortran.cpp and utils.h
